Interface_name: UDP communication by using socket in python
Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a UDP communication class that handles socket creation, data transmission, and reception with proper connection management and error handling.

Class Description: The UDPCommunication class provides functionality for UDP-based network communication, including opening/closing connections, sending/receiving data, and managing connection status. It uses threading for asynchronous data reception and includes signal-based notification for connection status changes.

Attributes:
- conn: [socket.socket] - The UDP socket object used for communication
- status: [ConnectionStatus] - Current connection status (CONNECTED/CLOSED)
- config: [dict] - Configuration dictionary containing protocol, port, and target information
- onConnectionStatus: [pyqtSignal] - Signal emitted when connection status changes
- hintSignal: [pyqtSignal] - Signal for displaying error messages or hints
- receiveProcess: [threading.Thread] - Thread handling incoming data reception

Methods:
- __init__() -> None - Initializes the UDP communication object with default configuration
- openCloseSerial() -> None - Toggles connection state (opens if closed, closes if open)
- receiveDataProcess(conn: socket.socket) -> None - Thread function for receiving data (private method)
- send(data: bytes) -> None - Sends data to configured target
- checkTarget(target: str) -> tuple - Validates and parses target address into (host, port) tuple
- isConnected() -> bool - Returns current connection status
- getConnStatus() -> ConnectionStatus - Returns current connection status object
